channel.title: Port forward
channel.description:
I successfully portforwarded, according to portforward.com's port checker
Port 43594
People are still unable to connect to me. what else could be the problem?

item.title: Port forward
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

If you have ATT: go into the Network settings of your wireless router

Start–>All Programs–>Accessories–>Run, then type: cmd
next type: IPconfig

write down or use Notepad to grab the “Gateway Default” digits and decimals you see. All of them, don’t forget.

next enter you web browsers address Bar and type, for Example:

http://192.168.1.254
(But, you would use your own digits and decimals here.)

You’ll need the Password to view the Firewall Settings…

Basically, you’re trying to command your router to obey you, so you try to find settings that look something like this, to uncheck them, or Enabling them.

uncheck- Excessive Session Detection
uncheck- TCP/UDP Port scan
uncheck- Invalid Source/Destination IP address

IF you have a different ISP, then Google how to make changes for allowing file sharing/person2person…opening ports, etc

Read full topic

item.title: Port forward
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

I dunno, make sure that Java SE Binary is unblocked in Windows Firewall I guess.
